page.title: 14Employment
page.content: During the 19 C the town was a centre for agriculture but the coming of a railway in 1842 provided many new jobs.It also contributed to the demise of the Medway Company causing the gradual loss of all work connected with river transport.Around the beginning of the 20th C Tonbridge became a stronghold for the printing trade providing employment for over one thousand of its inhabitants but in reason years declined.There has been a brickworks in the town since Victorian times and nowdays the company specialises in handmade bricks.Since the late 1960's there has been a further change in the type of available employment brought about by the establishment of a trading estate where various forms of light industry are to be found.
